title: Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen
summary: The Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen (French: DÃ©claration des droits de l'homme et du citoyen de 1789), set by France's National Constituent Assembly in 1789, is a human civil rights document from the French Revolution.[1] Inspired by Enlightenment philosophers, the Declaration was a core statement of the values of the French Revolution and had a major impact on the development of popular conceptions of individual liberty and democracy in Europe and worldwide.[2]
